item.title: Kristin add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "Let children read whatever they want and then talk about it with them. If parents and kids can talk together, we won't have as much censorship because we won't have as much fear." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Jane Smiley
item.description: "Many people, myself among them, feel better at the mere sight of a book." -- Jane Smiley

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Maureen Corrigan
item.description: "It's not that I don't like people. It's just that when I'm in the company of others - even my nearest and dearest - there always comes a moment when I'd rather be reading a book." -- Maureen Corrigan

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "I have a passion for teaching kids to become readers, to become comfortable with a book, not daunted. Books shouldn't be daunting, they should be funny, exciting and wonderful; and learning to be a reader gives a terrific advantage." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Charles Ogden
item.description: "Don't mark up the Library's copy, you fool! Librarians are Unprankable. They'll track you down! They have skills!" -- Charles Ogden

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Harold Howe
item.description: "What a school thinks about its library is a measure of what it feels about education." -- Harold Howe
